content.description: Easy 5.7 climbing leads to a definitive and tricky crux through a crack feature up high.  Well protected
content.location: First Route right of the bolted line.

content.description: A dirty opening on the face leads to a ledge and a good but still dirty crak in a dihedral.  At top of crack trend right through horizontals to shared anchors with "Charlie Brown".
content.location: Dihedral in middle of "Mini Block Wall"

content.description: Splitter crack on the far right side of Block Head wall just left of a seepy drainage.  No anchors as of yet but you can climb the crack and then break right at a little ledge to lower from the tree.
content.location: Far right side, (shady side) of Block Head Buttress.

climbs.name: One Flew Over the Coocoos Nest

content.description: Begin on decent holds with the tough decision of weather or not to rest your booty on the tree for a rest.  Climb through a couple finger locks to a cool arete feature with a really long move off of decent holds to excellent finishing holds.
content.location: Left most route under the huge "block head" feature.  The only bolted line on the Wall.

content.description: Begin on hard moves in a small dihedral to get off the ground and then follow the crack up and left through the hueco with decent holds and gear.
content.location: First Crack line from approach trail.  Starts beneath the diving board feature about 50 ft. up.

content.description: Fantastic and obvious route heading up the prow on the right side of Block Head buttress.  Low Crux into better holds and a long reach at the end.  Route finishes up and left of some serious choss stack at the top.  DO NOT go to bolt beneath upper roof as most of the rock around it is loose.
content.location: Bolted line Far right side of Block Head Buttress

content.description: Obvious "V" crack on the right side of the "mini block" wall.  Climb low angle terrain to ledge and follow right crack up to jugs that lead to the anchors.  DO NOT try and top it out through the jugs above chains.  They are so appealing yet are likely very fragile.
content.location: right side of MINI Block Wall

content.description: climb bulbousy face to the ledge and head towards the unique slash feature in the face.  Climb through the slash into jugs and finger buckets to the chains.
content.location: Bolted line right of obvious dihedral in middle of "Mini Block" wall.

content.description: Begin about 10 feet right of the depression of Bodacious, In the plumb line with the big finishing crack and the anchors.  Face climb through long reaches and bad gear to start, about 15 feet up the pro will become more plentiful.  Climb straight into the finishing crack of Bodacious.
Begin on moderate terrain in a depression mid wall.  Climb straight up to a right trending finger crack.  New anchors have been added for this route.
Left side of arete on "Mini Block Wall" this route begins up a short face into a crack that takes great gear and good feet to a few face pulls to the chains.  Shares Anchors with Block Party
content.protection: Standard Rack, shares anchors with Block Party.
content.location: Left side of arete on "Mini Block" Wall.  (break right halfway up approach to blockhead.)

content.description: Climb a dirty start to good holds that trend right up a flake feature.
content.location: Bolted line left of the routes that have the mid climb ledge.  One of the first routes reached from approach trail

content.description: First Route on the far left side of the "Mini Block" Wall.  Climb largh blocky crack into roofs with good horizontals.  Pull steep jugs until a harder and committing finish to make the anchors.
content.protection: Standard rack up to at least #3
content.location: "Mini Block" Wall.  Hike approach trail to block head buttress and break right to small wall about half way up approach.

content.description: Fart left side of Mini Block wall.  Face climb through good holds to left of depression.  Finish is the same as Block Chain.  Shared Anchors
content.location: Far Left side of Mini Block Wall

content.description: The second classic area up Crab Orchard Hollow.  Good Moderate trad routes and decent shade, unusual for the Guest.  This area is very easily identifiable by the enormous "block head" capping the wall.
